main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects occurred in the vicinity of Newton, Mississippi, and Lake Charles, Louisiana, between May and June of 1953.
interesting points: Sighting by a T-33 aircraft pilot who observed a whitish-green light traveling at high speed., The object appeared cylindrical and fired a smaller object before disappearing., An object was tracked on radar and visually observed moving with high speed before vanishing., Lt. William T. Hemphill Jr. reported seeing a celestial phenomenon that felt like an ordinary navigation light but exhibited unusual behavior., No physical evidence was found for any of the sightings, and several were classified as meteorological phenomena.
location: Newton, Mississippi - Lake Charles, Louisiana, USA
